Module ntnu.idatt1002
Package ntnu.idatt1002.dao

Class NotificationDAO

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt1002.dao.NotificationDAO
public final class NotificationDAO
extends java.lang.Object
The class NotificationDAO provides static methods for handling Notification objects. In the storage system the objects gets stored under the 'Notification' folder under their respective User folders.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    NotificationDAO()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static boolean delete​(java.lang.String username, int id)
    Delete a Notification file from storage that matches the given arguments.
    static boolean delete​(Notification notification)
    Delete a Notification file from storage.
    static boolean deleteByUser​(java.lang.String username)
    Delete all Notification objects stored under the given User folder.
    static Notification deserialize​(java.lang.String username, int id)
    Deserialize a Notification object from storage that matches the given arguments.
    static java.util.ArrayList<Notification> list​(java.lang.String username)
    Returns a ArrayList of all Notification objects under a User.
    static void serialize​(java.util.ArrayList<Notification> notifications)
    Serialize the given ArrayList of Notification objects.
    static void serialize​(Notification notification)
    Serialize the given Notification object to the storage system.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • NotificationDAO

      public NotificationDAO()

  • Method Details

    • list

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Notification> list​(java.lang.String username)
      Returns a ArrayList of all Notification objects under a User.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList, will be empty if no objects are stored or if the user doesn't exist.

    • serialize

      public static void serialize​(java.util.ArrayList<Notification> notifications)
      Serialize the given ArrayList of Notification objects. The list can contain objects belonging to different users, they will be stored in their respective folders.
      Parameters:
      notifications - an ArrayList of Notification objects.

    • serialize

      public static void serialize​(Notification notification)
      Serialize the given Notification object to the storage system. Will be stored under the 'Notifications' folder for a User.
      Parameters:
      notification - a Notification object.

    • deserialize

      public static Notification deserialize​(java.lang.String username, int id)
      Deserialize a Notification object from storage that matches the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      id - the notifId of the Notification.
      Returns:
      a Notification object, or null if file could not be found, either the user or a notification with the given id doesn't exist.

    • deleteByUser

      public static boolean deleteByUser​(java.lang.String username)
      Delete all Notification objects stored under the given User folder.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete, normally if the user doesn't exist.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(Notification notification)
      Delete a Notification file from storage.
      Parameters:
      notification - a Notification object that's stored.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if the file couldn't be deleted, normally since the file isn't stored.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(java.lang.String username, int id)
      Delete a Notification file from storage that matches the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      id - the notifId of the Notification.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if the file couldn't be deleted, either the user doesn't exist or a file with the given id doesn't exist.
